channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Political Turmoil Adds to the Economic Woes of South Korea
item.description: Even before a short-lived declaration of martial law thrust the country into crisis, the economy faced grim prospects.

item.title: Ken Griffin says crypto is exploding right now because more people want to have ‘agency’ in their lives
item.description: “Of course, I wish I bought something that trades at 100 times the price it traded at a few years ago,” Griffin said.

item.title: A tech company saw blockbuster results from U.K.’s first medical trial of a 4-day workweek. Yet, it’s ditching the model for one key reason
item.description: Before making four-day workweek the norm, there's a need for a “widespread cultural change across the U.K.,” Thrive's co-CEO said.

item.title: Chipotle admits to raising prices—the same day a top analyst spotted a protein price hike at 20% of its stores
item.description: The fast-casual Mexican chain has taken some heat for its inconsistent portion sizes, but analysts see better days ahead for Chipotle.

item.title: The Head of South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol’s Party Calls for His Impeachment
item.description: The leader of President Yoon Suk Yeol’s own party has backed impeachment, on which the National Assembly is set to vote on Saturday.

item.title: Trump Could Take Us to War With Iran. But He Could Also Broker Peace.
item.description: Over the next four years, the toxic and seemingly unending psychodrama between the United States and Iran may very well see its final act.

item.title: 3 Climbers From U.S. and Canada Presumed Dead on New Zealand’s Tallest Peak
item.description: The police suspended their search for two Americans and a Canadian who went missing while trying to reach the summit of Aoraki/Mount Cook.

item.title: South Korea’s Lawmakers Question Military About Yoon’s Martial Law Order
item.description: The military has spent decades trying to rehabilitate its image and win public trust after a brutal past. Its role in President Yoon’s martial law rai...

item.title: Trump names David Sacks as White House AI and crypto czar
item.description: In Sacks, Trump is tapping one of his most prominent Silicon Valley supporters and fundraisers for a prime position in his administration

item.title: How Notre-Dame Was Reborn
item.description: It took about 250 companies, 2,000 workers, about $900 million, a tight deadline and a lot of national pride.

item.title: Russia is speeding into a demographic crisis with a 25-year-low birth rate as the Ukraine war rages on
item.description: Russia has had similar troughs in its demographics during World War II and after the fall of the Soviet Union—but things are different this time.

item.title: The V.I.P. Trains Shuttling World Leaders Like Biden to War-Torn Ukraine
item.description: With airspace closed and missiles flying, visiting Kyiv typically means 10 hours on bumpy tracks — even for presidents, prime ministers and business m...

item.title: The Head of South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol’s Party Calls for His Impeachment
item.description: The leader of President Yoon Suk Yeol’s own party has backed impeachment, on which the National Assembly is set to vote on Saturday.

item.title: South Korean Who Grabbed Soldier’s Rifle: ‘I Couldn’t Back Down’
item.description: An Gwi-ryeong, a spokeswoman for a political party, went viral after confronting troops during South Korea’s night of martial law. “My first thought w...

item.title: Kindergartners Are ‘Critical but Stable’ After California School Shooting
item.description: Two boys were rushed to hospitals on Wednesday after they were shot by a gunman on their rural school campus in Northern California. The authorities s...
